title: Back to school: The best autumn ski skills courses
text: For those stuck on the intermediate plateau, it can feel like there's no way off. Sometimes the only answer is to get the help of an expert. Various schools and instructors run specialised courses in autumn to help hone skills and push intermediates up to the next level – and what better way to improve than to get technique tips pre-season, so that come the main event you'll be putting all that new-found knowledge into practice on the slopes. Here's our round-up of the best early-season courses, taking place from as early as October in the most snow-sure ski areas and glacier resorts, or at snow centres in the UK. Warren Smith Ski Academy Warren Smith, Telegraph Ski and Snowboard's ski skills editor, runs five day courses throughout autumn from November 1 onwards. These cater for all ability levels, and are designed to improve skiers' confidence and develop skills, including for tackling tricky terrain and moguls. The Warren Smith Ski Academy courses run from Sunday to Friday, with a day off on Wednesdays. Sessions start at 10.15am and finish at 3pm. The courses run throughout November and December Where: Cervinia, Italy When: Autumn courses run from November 1 to December 6 (the Academy continues to run courses throughout winter in Verbier, Switzerland) How much: £615 for a course package including six-day lift pass Target Experience the thrill of race training on Target 's five-day early-season course. Speed lovers, rejoice – this is a chance to perfect ski technique in slalom and giant slalom. Sessions include all-round technical training as well as giant slalom race training, with lots of drills and exercises to develop performance. There are also sessions to develop ski specific fitness with a personal trainer. Where: Hintertux, Austria When: November 17 to 21 How much: £400, course only • The best resorts for guaranteed snow Snoworks Off-piste specialist Snoworks runs five-day courses throughout autumn, offering either race training or all-terrain performance. The session hours are all day, or “until the lifts close”, with a quick break for lunch, meaning more tuition time for your money. All-terrain courses are aimed at those wanting to develop their skills all over the mountain, from backcountry terrain to lumps and bumps, while race training focuses on edge control and carving. Snoworks also runs a backcountry trip New Zealand in September. Where: Tignes, France When: Race courses and all-terrain courses run from October 17 How much: £300, course only Snoworks offers early-season race training courses TDC and VIP VIP Ski has teamed up with TDC Ski to offer early season packages from the end of November comprised of a three- or five-day ski clinic and seven nights' catered chalet accommodation. Rather than pre-planned lessons and drills, TDC's approach is based around coaching people on their style as an individual, helping skiers make a breakthrough in confidence and ability. Clinics have one to eight people per group, and run for three hours Monday to Wednesday, or Monday to Friday, am or pm. Access to two glaciers in the Espace Killy ski area means snow is assured even early in the season. Where: Val d'Isère, France When: From November 29 How much: From £579 for seven nights' chalet-board accommodation plus three-day clinic Courses in the UK A more affordable option to get a jump on next season is to take a class, clinic or course at one of the many indoor snow centres or dry ski slopes around the UK: Onyx has one-day camps at the end of September The Warren Smith Ski Academy runs full-day courses in September and October at The Snow Centre in Hemel Hempstead, Chill Factore in Manchester and Sno!Zone in Castleford. These one-day group sessions tackle moguls, steeps, powder and carving. How much: £129 per session, including tuition, lift pass and equipment hire. • The UK's best snow centres and dry ski slopes Snoworks offers UK-based bumps courses at Chill Factore in Manchester and Sno!Zone in Castleford. These one-day courses run in September and October. How much: £125 per session including tuition, lift pass and equipment hire. Onyx delivers one-day freestyle snowboard camps at both The Snow Centre in Hemel Hempstead and Sno!Zone in Castleford in late September, focusing on tricks, features and generally improving participants' riding. How much: £110 per session, includes lift pass, coaching, two video feedback sessions and an off snow Onyx mini master class. Telegraphtravel Follow @telegraphtravel
